pageTitle: Bus route 295 to go 24-hour from 15 September

title.title: Bus route 295 to go 24-hour from 15 September

texts: Transport for London has announced that from Saturday 15 September, the route 295 bus service, which runs from Ladbroke Grove (Sainsbury's) to Clapham Junction, will run 24 hours a day.
The new 24-hour service on route 295 is another accessible transport connection for late-night travellers
The route will provide a half-hourly service throughout the night, seven days a week. It will improve night-time links from Ladbroke Grove to Shepherd's Bush, Hammersmith and Clapham Junction.
John Barry, Head of Network Development for London Buses, said: "The new 24-hour service on route 295 is another accessible transport connection for late-night travellers in the Capital.
"London's night bus network has expanded dramatically in recent years with passenger numbers more than doubling since 2000. Almost half the users are people travelling to or from work."
The change comes following a review of the existing service.

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["All London's buses have in-vehicle CCTV and all except the Heritage Routemasters are accessible to wheelchair users","With over 8000 buses on approximately 700 routes the London bus network has seen usage increase by 45 per cent since 1999/2000","The route 295 daytime service will remain unchanged"]}
